definitions.definition: To step or walk (on or across something); to trample .
examples: He trod back and forth wearily.

definitions.definition: To proceed , to behave (in a certain manner).
definitions.label_groups: figuratively , with certain adverbs of manner

definitions.definition: To beat or press with the feet.
examples: to tread a path; to tread land when too light; a well- trodden path

definitions.definition: To work a lever , treadle , etc., with the foot or the feet.
To go through or accomplish by walking, dancing, etc.
To crush under the foot; to trample in contempt or hatred; to subdue ; to repress .
To copulate ; said of (especially male ) birds .
To crush grapes with one's feet to make wine

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To step or walk (on or across something); to trample .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To step or walk upon.
( figuratively , with certain adverbs of manner ) To proceed , to behave (in a certain manner).
To beat or press with the feet.
To work a lever , treadle , etc., with the foot or the feet.
To go through or accomplish by walking, dancing, etc.
To crush under the foot; to trample in contempt or hatred; to subdue ; to repress .
( intransitive ) To copulate ; said of (especially male ) birds .
( transitive , of a male bird ) To copulate with.
( transitive ) To crush grapes with one's feet to make wine
